captions.text: - [Voiceover] How often do you shower?
Once?
Twice a day?
Some of you may not even shower at all,
but how often should you actually shower?
According to dermatologists,

Dr. Joshua Zeichner
and Dr. Ranella Hirsch,

a lot of the reasons we do it
is because of societal norms

and that it's really more
of a cultural phenomenon.
Well, frequent showering may actually
be doing you more harm than good.

Showering too often,
especially with hot water,
actually is bad for your skin.

You wash away the good
bacteria and dry out your skin,
which puts small cracks that put you
in higher risk of infection.
If you have babies or toddlers,
exposing them to dirt and bacteria

may actually help their
skin become less sensitive,

preventing allergies and
conditions like eczema.
So, back to the question.
How often should you shower?

In general, you can
probably skip a day or two.
Taking one every two to three days,
that doesn't seem so bad, right?
For those no shower days,

just use a washcloth or
a cleansing towelette
on the grosser parts of your body,
under arms, under breasts, genitals,
your butt, and your face.
Think of all the water you'll save.
Mother Earth will be pleased.

Of course, your showering
needs will depend on

climate and how active you
are, but be reasonable.
If you're filthy, hit the showers.
(shower sounds)

comments.text:

wash your hair too much it'll get really greasy.﻿

Fuck that!  I live in Miami.I have to shower twice a day!! Somtimes three

NOTHING wakes someones up  better than shower. And you want to relax... 
bath!!! Better than cigs, pot or alcohol! Actually, you can mix them up. It

wine (Pinot Grigrio) and candle lights! Don't go back to 1800's!﻿

comments.text:
Guys..my hair gets greasy too, but who cares?
I mean some kids used to laugh at me when I was younger because I had 
greasy hair, I didn't want to shower everyday. At some point I started 
showering every single day, and my hair would great greasy after only a few 
hours. So now, I always skip atleast a day between my showers, and my hair 
is fine. On my last day before I shower, it's always a bit greasy yea, but 
I just tie my hair, do my things, and then shower at the end of the day.

Who cares if you got greasy hair? it's natural! There's no problem with 
that. It happens to everyone! I don't like the feeling of greasy hair, but 
I won't start showering every day and maybe even more than once a day just 
because of that. People actually don't care when my hair gets a little 
dirty and you know what? I noticed they do too. Because they are humans.﻿

comments.author: wpgirl01

comments.text:
I shower once a week on average. It's an odd process, because I do like 
being clean, but I don't like the feeling of /getting/ (not that I don't 
like the feeling of being dirty; it's actually kind of nice) dirty -- thus, 
if I'm dirty, I cannot get dirty, cuz I'm already dirty. It's just the 
initial shift from "clean" to "dirty" that's unpleasant. But again, I 
embrace the oils, sweat, and dirt that collects; it makes me feel more 
genuine. Two showers a day for me is just...

No.﻿
